content:
Thunderbird is only available for Windows, Linux and macOS and there is the K9 version of Thunderbird for Android.

There is no mobile version for iPhone/iPad using iOS/iPadOS yet.

https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/thunderbird-for-iphone-and-ipad/idc-p/39669/highlight/true#M23114
creator: James

content: It appears you didn't do the steps exactly as presented, as renaming wasn't part of it. A quick summary of those steps: - exit thunderbird on old PC - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external media - install thunderbird on new PC if not already done. Be sure to exit thunderbird if running - copy the backed up thunderbird folder from external media to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming which will overwrite the default thunderbird folder there - restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: Se usi IMAP come protocollo e accedi allo stesso account da altri dispositivi (browser, smartphone, app, etc.), Thunderbird replica esattamente le azioni che hai fatto da uno qualsiasi degli altri dispositivi collegati. Questa è di solito la causa di questo genere di problema

content:
1. Please use a tool like https://windirstat.net/download.html to find which directory in Windows is using the most space, and find the largest file. What is the file name?

2. Does that file name match to a folder in Thunderbird? And how much space does Thunderbird think that folder is using?
creator: wsmwk

content: The IMAP folder (C:\Users\USER\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\USER_PROFILE\ImapMail) takes up 99 GB. I see that .nstmp files take up the most space (as much as 63 GB). I have 44 of these files... Can I delete them and my messages on the disk and server will not be deleted?
creator: handel31

content:
Yes, you can delete the nstmp files.

You are using version 115?
creator: wsmwk

content: Yes, my version is 115.10.0

content: Those files are created when an attempted compaction fails. One possibility is having large message files.

content: Are you a Yahoo email user? If so there seems to be a problem when you have Delete Trash on exit ticked and are using IMAP in settings. Might be an issue with SSL/TLS As a temporary fix you can untick Delete on Exit checkbox setting and it should be OK.
creator: richard.duffin

content: Should add you will have to manually delete messages in the Deleted folder until this is fixed

content: There's no simpler Thunderbird version, but you can make it easier by changing the settings and removing extras you don't use. Mozilla's help pages can guide you to make it more user-friendly.

content: You cannot change an account from POP to IMAP. If that is desired, you would need to create a separate IMAP account alongside the POP account.
